answers.text:
Hi Nate, 
Thank you for the question on citizenvestor.com. We have a few example of its use on the Knowledge Network. If you have more questions you can try reaching out to some of the communities in listed documents to learn more about their experience. 
Crowdfunding Lends a Hand to Civic Projects is a blog post from this summer which includes information on citizenvestor.com
http://icma.org/en/results/sustainable_communities/resources/blogpost/1432/Crowdfunding_Lends_a_Hand_to_Civic_Projects
Here is a previously asked question where Knowledge Network users weigh in on different crowdfunding sources including citiznvestor.com http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/22435
Here is a case study on how local governments have utilized crowdfunding sources to make sustainability projects happen. http://icma.org/en/BlogPost/929/Getting_Community_BuyIn__Crowdfunding_to_Raise_Dollars_for_Sustainability
I hope these resources help you to learn more about citizenvestor.com and about other crowdfunding options so your local government is able to pick the platform that best suits your needs. Please feel free to ask additional questions on the Knowledge Network and to share your case study with us when you finish your project! 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org
